head.title: The Feeling...of...Falling...Asleep; Under a Wet Tin Roof

hedline.hl1: The Feeling...of...Falling...Asleep; Under a Wet Tin Roof

abstract.p: Letter from George A Flynn on William Sorensen's July 25 Op-Ed on unending quest for perfect sleep on vacation and at other times

block.p: William Sorensen demonstrated impressive expertise in ''Maybe Not Tanned, but Rested'' (Op-Ed, July 25), about the unending quest for perfect sleep.

But I am surprised that with his mention of under-the-stars sleep and slumber within earshot of a rushing stream, he did not mention the epitome of prized sopor: sleeping under a tin roof in the rain. This is closely followed by the patter of rain on fall leaves outside an open window.
William Sorensen demonstrated impressive expertise in ''Maybe Not Tanned, but Rested'' (Op-Ed, July 25), about the unending quest for perfect sleep.

But I am surprised that with his mention of under-the-stars sleep and slumber within earshot of a rushing stream, he did not mention the epitome of prized sopor: sleeping under a tin roof in the rain. This is closely followed by the patter of rain on fall leaves outside an open window.
I would include dozing to the rhythm of the rain on a tent, except for memories of the inevitable soggy awakenings.
GEORGE A. FLYNN Corpus Christi, Tex., July 25, 2000
